user_message:
An agent A claimed that the following MHD_resume_connection code violates the MISRA C 2023 rule 1.2.
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<target_code>
Here is the original code of MHD_resume_connection.
```c
_MHD_EXTERN void
MHD_resume_connection (struct MHD_Connection *connection)
{
  struct MHD_Daemon *daemon = connection->daemon;
#if defined(MHD_USE_THREADS)
  mhd_assert (NULL == daemon->worker_pool);
#endif /* MHD_USE_THREADS */

  if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME))
    MHD_PANIC (_ ("Cannot resume connections without enabling " \
                  "MHD_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME!\n"));
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  MHD_mutex_lock_chk_ (&daemon->cleanup_connection_mutex);
#endif
  connection->resuming = true;
  daemon->resuming = true;
#if defined(MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS) || defined(MHD_USE_W32_THREADS)
  MHD_mutex_unlock_chk_ (&daemon->cleanup_connection_mutex);
#endif
  if ( (MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_ (daemon->itc)) &&
       (! MHD_itc_activate_ (daemon->itc, "r")) )
  {
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
    MHD_DLOG (daemon,
              _ ("Failed to signal resume via inter-thread " \
                 "communication channel.\n"));
#endif
  }
}
```
</target_code>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- explanation: your evaluation of the scenario provided by the agent A.
- is_report_correct: whether the report is correct or not (true/false). True means there is a violation.
</response format>
<scenario>
The agent A provided the following violation scenario:
The macro _MHD_EXTERN expands to the GCC-specific attribute syntax __attribute__((visibility("default"))) which is a compiler language extension (GCC attribute syntax) documented as an extension; this use of a compiler-specific attribute violates MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
</scenario>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function MHD_resume_connection:
#define _MHD_EXTERN __attribute__((visibility("default")))extern
...
#define MHD_PANIC(msg) do{mhd_panic(mhd_panic_cls,__FILE__,__LINE__,msg);BUILTIN_NOT_REACHED;}while(0)
...
#define MHD_ITC_IS_VALID_(itc) (-1!=((itc).fd))
...
#define MHD_itc_activate_(itc, str) ((write((itc).fd,(constvoid*)&_MHD_itc_wr_data,sizeof(_MHD_itc_wr_data))>0)||(EAGAIN==errno))
...
#define MHD_mutex_lock_chk_(pmutex) do{if(!MHD_mutex_lock_(pmutex))MHD_PANIC(_("Failed to lock mutex.\n"));\
}while(0)
...
#define MHD_mutex_unlock_chk_(pmutex) do{if(!MHD_mutex_unlock_(pmutex))MHD_PANIC(_("Failed to unlock mutex.\n"));\
}while(0)
...
void
MHD_DLOG (const struct MHD_Daemon *daemon,
          const char *format,
          ...)
{
  va_list va;

  if (0 == (daemon->options & MHD_USE_ERROR_LOG))
    return;
  va_start (va, format);
  daemon->custom_error_log (daemon->custom_error_log_cls,
                            format,
                            va);
  va_end (va);
}
...
#define MHD_TEST_ALLOW_SUSPEND_RESUME 8192
...
#define MHD_USE_THREADS 1
...
#define MHD_USE_POSIX_THREADS 1
...
#define HAVE_MESSAGES 1
</additional code>

<instruction>
Judge whether the report is correct or not.
</instruction>
explanation: The report is correct. The function is declared as "_MHD_EXTERN void MHD_resume_connection(...)" and the provided macro definition shows _MHD_EXTERN expands to __attribute__((visibility("default"))) extern. The GCC-style __attribute__((...)) syntax is a compiler-specific language extension (not part of standard C) and is documented as an extension in GCC documentation. MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 prohibits use of language extensions, so this use is a violation. (A compliant alternative would be to remove the attribute or conditionally define the macro to expand to just "extern" when a compiler without that extension is used.)
